WorkItem.Description: Add Certificate Expiration Date in the 'About' form.

Comments.Message: Maybe add a kind of warning "Popup" or "red button" or something like that if the certificate lifetime is about to expire in 2 weeks (or configurable).
Hi Norbert, in the About Form, the field with Expiration date is in Orange when the Certificate expire in less than 30 days, and WPP advices the user at each start.
For me its OK, Norbert it is OK for you too? ;)
I would prefer a more prominent info about the expiration. But I guess thats not the most important problem at the Moment.  ;)
If i remember correct, you will get a Messagebox even WPP is started. DCourtel, is it correct?

Must connect to the Wsus server to allow WPP to see if there is a certificate and to get his expiration date.
So each time WPP connect to a Wsus server, it check if the certificate is OK. If not, a MessageBow appeare saying what king of problem there is. See the screenshot
The user won't be able to publish an update until he has solved the certificate probleme.
